storyInfo: Old depots wither, and the light industry district rises. The police takes sides in the gang wars. Facing Norport Borough's inevitable decline, Morgan finds her place, in her own way, and puts the borough under her control.

attributes.text: Vina, Hannah, Baird... we walk into the wind on the great avenue, our shirts hanging open in the wind.
\nThe Originium lights never sleep. Norport's border checkpoints are like huge gaping mouths, churning through imports and exports.
\nWeighers' joints ache with tendonitis from overwork. The calluses on the shoulders of loaders grow thick and solid.
\nNorport will become Victoria's most prosperous borough.
Norport Borough will belong to the Glasgow Gang.
\nWhoever controls Norport controls Londinium, controls Victoria.

attributes.content: What's the coppers doing?
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Dunno. We was occupied wif sendin' the boss to hospital.
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: What 'appened to the boss?
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Crate ta the head. Knocked out cold straight up. Blood everywhere. A right picture that was.
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: Who started it?
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Them! And I know they pushed the boss into that forklift on purpose!
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: Saints alive, those Sudean bastards is shittin' down our necks now that they've got sixpence to rub together!
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: We left us some boys there. Should get word if there's any news.
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: Any time now.
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: You really expect the coppers'll play fair?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hold it for a minute, Hannah, love.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Outsiders? Who let them in?
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Lane Brothers' Gang, right? We're here representin' the Glasgow Gang. We heard about Mr. Lane's injury and wanted to pay our respects.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Glasgow Gang... I've heard the name...
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Thanks, anyways.
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: (I told you he'd be in hospital, but you insisted on coming to their hideout.)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We'll do more good here than at the hospital. It's called 'in the hour of need.'
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: (Keep it down!)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: *pant* Lemme catch my breath...
attributes.name: Gangster Messenger

attributes.content: What's the word from the coppers?
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: Locked up a few boys and said they're takin' the boss in for questioning once he's out of 'ospital.
attributes.name: Gangster Messenger

attributes.content: Word is they plan to crack down on Norport gangs causin' trouble for Sudean factories, and that any ringleaders would be punished severely.
attributes.name: Gangster Messenger

attributes.content: Well, somethin' like that.
attributes.name: Gangster Messenger

attributes.content: What about the bastard who hurt the boss?
attributes.name: Gangster B

attributes.content: Coppers let him off with a small fine.
attributes.name: Gangster Messenger
Gangster A
attributes.content: Piece of shit brass-bollocking,

attributes.name: Gangster A
attributes.content: PC Plod wankfest parade of...

attributes.name: Gangster A
attributes.content: PC Plod wankfest parade of...

attributes.name: Gangster A
attributes.content: Ah, shit, I need the whole dictionary!
Calm down.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I told you, ya can't count on the coppers.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I say we go into Sudean, find the son of a stockbeast who hurt Mr. Lane, and rip his bloody head off.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: They've been tramplin' us for long enough! It's about time we got back at 'em!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: She's right, our friend here from, er... Glasgow! Glasgow Gang!
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: Let's get 'em!
attributes.name: Gangster A

attributes.content: We'll get 'em!
attributes.name: Gangster

attributes.content: I'm comin' too!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah, love, Vina sent us to find Mr. Lane.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Don't get mixed up in their business.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This is about all of Norport! We've all gotta step up!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Two more draught beers. Make 'em big.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Don't drink too much, Hannah. There's a soapy taste to today's beer.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I knew you were addin' flavor capsules to it. Just didn't bother to call you out.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hehe...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Why'd you stop me?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah, you daft cat. You forgotten what happened at the cinema last week?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The glassworkers were hogging up tapes and places at McClaren's video store. They got into a fight with our people, brought the coppers right in.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But they went back to Sudean without losing a hair.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Makes me mad just thinkin' about it.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The cops are taking their side even on our own turf. I'm not the slightest bit surprised at how they dealt with this.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That's why we need to get back at 'em. We can't count on the cops!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Ai-yi-yi, no one's counting on the cops. Use your brain, love.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This is a big deal. They did it this way on purpose, just waiting for somebody to make a move to give them an excuse to clean up.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The real question is, why are the coppers taking sides?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This ain't anything new. It's been happening for years.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Bloody 'ell, I got no idea.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Two bowls of beer soup, Paul, nice and hot.
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: Extra croutons on top.
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: I guess the envelope was too thin to catch the attention of those bigwigs at the Sudean Labor Office.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: But that's already a year's savings...
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Don't think about it now. This one's on me.
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: Thanks...
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Still need to look for a way to move to Sudean. Having to cross boroughs to go to work every day is rough...
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Sure 'nuff...
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: Who would've thought ten years ago that people from Norport would be flocking to Sudean factories and docks?
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: Times change. When you're down, you're down.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: We used to have the most depots in Londinium, and the biggest ones too. We were the door to the city. Ever since light industry in Sudean took off, though...
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Textiles, glassware, cans, appliances... they just keep building factories and producing more stuff.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Then came the depots, and you could see Norport falling before your eyes.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Only two things keep growing on the streets: one, young people who've joined the gangs, spending their days at the cinemas, billiard clubs and bars.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: The other, poorhouses, which barely scratch the surface of the problem. There are so many people living off unemployment aid in Norport, and Londinium wants no more to do with us.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: Morgan thinks back to the page of Morgan's Memoirs that she tore off. Beer goes down, memories come up.
Trucks and carts loading and unloading, tailor shops and magazine stalls all over the streets, smiles everywhere.
Hotel bellboys on Sunset Street, so busy they hardly get a drink of water all day.
Merchants and high society from all over Victoria and as far away as Leithanien and Kazimierz, checking in one after another.
It was the face of Londinium.
How did it turn out like this?
Morgan gulps down the rest of her mug. Twenty years of Norport, two decades of her life, down the throat with the beer.
Well, stuff me.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Let's go. Early shift tomorrow.
attributes.name: Tired Worker

attributes.content: I'm stopping by the Labor Office again tomorrow. You oughta come along, move to Sudean too, if you know what's good for you.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: I know what you're thinking. I'll miss it too. But you never know when Londinium will decide to cast it away.
attributes.name: Depressed Worker

attributes.content: You remember those two, Hannah?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They used to be weighers on the docks. True blue Berties. People I looked up to when I was little...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: If the Berties stopped caring about Norport, there might really come a day when Londinium casts Norport aside, as they said.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: This is our fight.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I never said it wasn't.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hannah, you daft cat, we both know you and me could go to Sudean right now, dig up whoever hurt Mr. Lane, beat him senseless, even put him in the ground.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But a fight won't solve our problems.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Don't worry, I've been thinking about it.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I hope you're right.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Two weeks later...
Why are you pacing in circles? Is the new sofa too hard for you?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You called us all here for a job. What is it? Are we gonna get back at them for what they did to Mr. Lane?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Slow down.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Lane Brothers are through, Vina.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The man himself is still lying in a hospital bed, and they're just gonna give up? Throw away their hideout?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Weren't they all up in arms, ready to set fire to the other side's factories?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: They got a bunch of people together a couple of times, but they were stopped before they could leave Norport. Things just fell apart after that.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The Sudean Labor Office recruited a new lot of workers from Norport this week. A few Lane Brothers heavies were on the list.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: The Lane Brothers couldn't stay together without anyone running the show.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Those traitors!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: We can't blame them.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Lane Brothers used to watch over the biggest warehouses around here, collecting enough protection money to feed a few hundred mouths.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's hard to keep up in the sorry state of Norport's markets today.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Everyone's here, Vina. They're waiting outside.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Alright, let's go.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Where to?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: The Lane Brothers' hideout.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Glasgow Gang will take in anyone from the Lane Brothers who has nowhere to go.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What're you on about?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Don't you get it, Hannah? We're taking over Lane Brothers territory.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: That's like robbin' a man while his house is on fire!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I suppose you could put it like that.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Why are we doing this?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's a long story; I'll explain on the way. Grab your stuff and we'll head out. There's a lot to do today.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Not just the Lane Brothers' warehouses; cinemas, billiard clubs, cafes, hotels... we're visiting half the establishments in Norport.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You'll have plenty of things to punch today.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Norport's gangs may not be all that big, but everyone sticks to their territory, and sticks together when there's trouble from outside.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That's why the other boroughs never tried to mess with us.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Vina's only been in Norport a few years. You and Morgan and me grew up here. How could we sign on to this?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hey, where is Morgan? Does she know what we're doin'?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: It's Morgan's plan, Hannah.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: She's not with us today because she has her own job to do.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I'm here. I'm alone. Show yourself.
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: Who are you? Sneaking around like that, throwing letters tied to rocks... you broke my window, dammit.
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: And your writing's real ugly.
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: Hah!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: My writing's ugly?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hey, what's with the machete?!
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: No funny stuff, I'm warning you. Lots of boys around here. All I need to do is shout.
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: Go on, shout. You read my letter.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Why you...
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: You should be glad it's me here and not my friends. I came to talk. This is only for when talking goes wrong.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Bernie from Romi Textiles in Sudean Borough, am I right? Just double-checking.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The stuff in the envelope. How did you find out?
attributes.name: Wary Man

attributes.content: The unstamped lists of goods and invoices with your name on it?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It wasn't hard. Took me just two weeks to put together all you did this past year.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Pirated videos, unprocessed spices, Arts generators, Originium equipment... all controlled goods in Sudean that you sneaked through the checkpoints.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What would Mr. Romi do if he found out his foreman has been runnin' a smuggling hustle through his factory?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Would he break your legs, or hand you over to the coppers so they can do it?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Remember Mr. Lane? You got into a fight with him here two weeks ago. Sent him to the hospital.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: He's still there. I think you owe him an apology, and his medical bills too. Not a pence short.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Oh, so it's the Lane Brothers. Took you two weeks to do something, did it?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Wait a minute, I thought you were wound up.
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: The Lane Brothers' Gang is no more.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm Morgan. Morgan of the Glasgow Gang.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Remember the name. This won't be the last time we do business.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Pah, what business could we possibly have with Norport?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Look at that train behind you, girl. A dozen carriages, carrying more in a day than your old docks see in a week.
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Look at all those elevators and carts working around the clock, and rows of factories stretching as far as the eye can see. You got those in Norport?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Tell you what. I'll find you a job on the line, and you give me the originals of what was in that envelope. How's that for a deal?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: What are you doing?
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: The 'brain' of the Glasgow Gang walks up to the man, smiling, and buries her fist in his belly.
The man falls to his knees, grabbing his stomach, his face twisted in pain.
He looks up to see the young Feline glaring down at him. Her face is pretty; her expression, less so.
Gah...
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: Got distracted by the machete...
attributes.name: Wary Smuggler

attributes.content: For all that Sudean has, you smuggled all this stuff through Norport, taking the long way round.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sudean's checkpoints are pretty strict, aren't they? Isn't it interesting how certain things only get into Londinium through the old depots?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The gangs of Norport have been struggling to stay afloat for a couple of years. Starting today, though, the Glasgow Gang runs the show in Norport. All of it.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You want to keep your hustle, you keep your tail firmly between your legs.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You can go now. You can guess what happens if you don't show up at the hospital before the sun sets.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: A word of advice. People like you and I, trying to get on top of one another? There's no point to any of it.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Yes, Sudean is booming right now. Lots of smokestacks, lots of workers. You're drawing a lot of envy.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But have you ever set foot in Auchterigg?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Have you seen the nobles' mansions? Alleys wider than a central avenue in Sudean?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Their clothes are always sparkling clean. They don't punch their timecards for the morning shift, and they don't watch pirated video tapes when they get off in the evening. They drink tea in gardens bigger than any of the factories behind you.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sudean, Norport? It's all the same to them.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Who knows if Sudean won't become the next Norport? Maybe a new industry rises in another borough in a few years to take your place.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We're all the same to Londinium, Bernie. They can throw us out at any time.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We can't keep up with the changing times.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm back.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Is everything fine, Morgan?
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Of course I'm fine. Bernie, not so much. He should be in Mr. Lane's ward as we speak.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Too bad none of you were there to watch the showdown between Kate Morrigan and Sudean's throng of smugglers.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Well, I'll be sure to write it down in my memoirs for you to enjoy.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Oh, please, gimme a break.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hahahaha...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: What have you been up to?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Took in a dozen lads from the Lane Brothers who accepted Vina as their new boss. You'll be able to write while watching the warehouses from now on.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: We visited seven gangs today. Talked three into joining. Hannah and I beat the other four into submission.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But the markets of Norport are barren, and the gangs living off it a bunch of loose rabble. It's a disorganized mess, not something that you can just bring together in the blink of an eye.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No hurry. The Glasgow Gang is in this for the long haul.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Thanks for agreeing to it, Vina.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I've always wanted to ask you... who does Londinium belong to?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: One or two boroughs more or less won't make much of a difference to Londinium. Who are we, then? What are we?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Could Londinium actually cast Norport away?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I don't know the answer, Morgan. I'm still looking for it, myself... for Londinium, and for Victoria.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But I'm part of the Glasgow Gang, which makes me part of Norport.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I can't make any promises, but I won't stand idly by, if the day comes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No need to promise us anything.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: We're not afraid, as long as we stick together.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Exactly! Let's see the fat cats of Central Londinium try. I'll kick down the doors of their mansions and punch 'em square in the face.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I'll pour boiling coffee on their evening dresses.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I'll take care of the arson.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: What about you, Morgan?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Don't worry, I won't stop you, if it comes to that.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You're right. No need to overthink.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We're not the nobles. We can't build a big project to revitalize a borough in decline, or run some policies to help the people who live here.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But there are things the people of Norport can do for themselves.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Sure enough.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: So why didn't you tell your plan earlier, Morgan?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah, you daft cat, did you really think those muscles in your brain would understand?
attributes.name: Morgan
